intro: Cryptantha bradburiana, commonly known as the Bradbury cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a low, sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
